intro: Millettia gossweileri var. melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-fruited millettia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, dark-colored fruits. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind or animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. The botanical features of this plant make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
